author: jeremy-browne
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

```
$headers = @{
        "Accept"           = "application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01"
        "UserId"           = "$myUserID"
        "Device"           = "$myDeviceName"
        "X-Requested-With" = "XMLHttpRequest"
        "User-Agent"       = "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/85.0.4183.102 Safari/537.36"
        "Token"            = "$myToken"
        "Sec-Fetch-Site"   = "same-origin"
        "Sec-Fetch-Mode"   = "cors"
        "Sec-Fetch-Dest"   = "empty"
        "Referer"          = "https://mywork.au-1.mycompany.io/managedevice/settings/device"
        "Accept-Encoding"  = "gzip, deflate, br"
        "Accept-Language"  = "en-GB,en-US;q=0.9,en;q=0.8"
        "Cookie"           = "$myDeliciousCookie"
}

function Get-ObjectLists {
    $pageURL = "https://myurl.au-1.mycompany.io/config/device/ajax/aliases"
    $request = Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $pageURL -Headers $headers -ContentType "application/json; charset=utf-8"
    $request = $request.content | ConvertFrom-Json
    return $request.data
}
```

## Expected behavior

```
Running the above function will return my requested data

```

## Actual behavior

```
ParserError: 
Line |
   1 |  function Get-ObjectLists {
     |  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | This script contains malicious content and has been blocked by your antivirus software.

- Interestingly, if I run the script via debugging (F5 in vscode) the function is run and my data is returned no problem. 
- I only seem to encounter this issue when testing the function by itself.
- Specifically, I highlight the code I want to run, right click, "Run Selection"

```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

VSCode
Version: 1.49.3 (user setup)
Commit: 2af051012b66169dde0c4dfae3f5ef48f787ff69
Date: 2020-10-02T17:57:01.595Z
Electron: 9.2.1
Chrome: 83.0.4103.122
Node.js: 12.14.1
V8: 8.3.110.13-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19041

```

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body: I can't find any docs or notices around it but I know a recent Windows Defender definition had gone out that blocked some modules from running. I would check the logs for defender/your anti virus provider to see why they have blocked the code from running. If it was defender this should be solved sometime in the future, maybe it is already, as this script doesn't look too malicious.

comments.author: scriptingstudio
comments.body: Can confirm. It is Defender that is fault.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: My bug report
